identificationModule.briefTitle: Aging and Marijuana: Benefits, Effects, and Risks
identificationModule.officialTitle: Cannabis Use Among Older Adults: Potential Risks and Benefits to an Aging Population

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Investigators will gather data on both the beneficial and harmful effects of edible cannabis of varying composition (THC-only vs. CBD-only vs. THC+CBD), and will examine the process by which older adult cannabis users decide what type of cannabis product is preferred.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Older adults are currently the fastest growing group of cannabis users in the U.S, and are more likely to use cannabis for medicinal purposes (e.g., pain, trouble sleeping, depression/anxiety) than for recreational purposes, despite having little data to guide their decisions about what type of product to use. This project utilizes a patient-centered observational design to recruit and assess older adults who are interested in using cannabis compared to a control group who is not interested in cannabis use. Investigators will gather data on both the beneficial and harmful effects of edible cannabis of varying composition (THC-only vs. CBD-only vs. THC+CBD), and will examine the process by which older adult cannabis users decide what type of cannabis product is preferred.

armGroups.label: Cannabis Users
armGroups.description: Older adults (60 and up) who report pain, sleep problems, and/or negative mood (anxiety and/or depression) and who desire to use cannabis for these issues (n=300)

armGroups.label: Cannabis Non-users
armGroups.description: Older adults (60 and up) who report pain, sleep problems, and/or negative mood (anxiety and/or depression) and do NOT desire to use cannabis for these issues (n=50)

interventions.name: Choice of cannabis product
interventions.description: Participants choose and purchase their own cannabis product

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Patient Global Impression of Change
primaryOutcomes.description: Self report of whether symptoms have improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Self-report of whether cognitive function has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Task
primaryOutcomes.description: Test of whether working memory has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Stability with eyes closed and eyes open

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Activities Specific Balance Confidence Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: Self-report of whether confidence in balance has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety Stress Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-report of whether depression, anxiety and stress have improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Self-report of whether sleep quality has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Measure of whether experience of fatigue has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Self-report of whether the extent to which pain interferes with daily life activities has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in pain Intensity past 7 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-report of whether intensity of pain has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Self-reported intensity of pain right now

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Addiction Research Center Inventory Marijuana Survey

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-report of whether general health and functioning has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Measure of whether number and dosage of current medications has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Online Timeline Follow-back Assessment
secondaryOutcomes.description: 30-day retrospective report of substance use (cannabis, alcohol, other drugs); measure of whether substance use has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same
Self-report of whether frequency and quantity of cannabis use changes over time or stays the same

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Blood Cannabinoids and Endocannabinoids
otherOutcomes.description: Quantitation of major and minor cannabinoids and endocannabinoids in blood; measure of whether cannabinoid levels change over time
Quantitation of neuronal damage in blood; measure of whether damage change over time
Self-report of whether opinions about the health effects of cannabis has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Flanker Inhibitory Control and Attention task
otherOutcomes.description: Measure of whether inhibition has improved, gotten worse, or stayed the same

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* At least 60 years of age
* Able to provide informed consent
* Cannabis Users: Must not currently use cannabis more than 7 times per month and not for pain, sleep, depression or anxiety in the past 6 months
* Cannabis Non-users: Should NOT have used cannabis in the past year and have not used regularly (e.g., more than weekly) for more than one year in the past 20 years
* Cannabis Users: Must be interested in using cannabis for at least one of the following complains: pain, sleep problems, depression, anxiety
* Non-users: Must NOT be interested in using cannabis but have at least one of the following complaints: pain, sleep problems, depression, anxiety
* Cannabis users: must be comfortable using edible cannabis and having a mobile laboratory (Dodge van) parked at their home
* Female participants must be postmenopausal
* Comfortable reading and writing in English
* Planning to stay in the Boulder/Denver area for the next month
* Must be comfortable with blood draws

Exclusion Criteria:

* Blood alcohol level \> 0 at screening (to sign consent form)
* Report of other drug use (cocaine, opiates, methamphetamine) in the past 90 days or fail urine screen for any of these drugs
* Past or current diagnosis of psychosis
* Current use of antipsychotic medications
* Heavy drinking; Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test (AUDIT) test score \>8
* Inability/discomfort/unwillingness with getting in and out of the mobile laboratory van
* History of vertigo or falls within the past six months
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Older adults experiencing problems with pain, sleep, depression or anxiety who either wish to use cannabis or who do not wish to cannabis
